etymology.description: Phono-semantic: semantic 人 (“person”) + phonetic 可 (OC *kʰaːlʔ); originally a pictogram of a man carrying something; some analyses also read it as 人 + 戈.
etymology.interpretation: Early forms depicted a person carrying a load, later reanalyzed as 人 providing meaning and 可 providing the sound, yielding the modern graph. Some traditions also see 戈 as the carried object, making an alternative 人 + 戈 analysis, but the standard modern form derives from 人 + 可.

examples.chinese: 我们将确认何时出发的安排(我們將確認何時出發的安排)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen jiāng quèrèn héshí chūfā de ānpái.
examples.english: We will confirm when to depart.

examples.chinese: 她不明白为何事情会变成这样(她不明白為何事情會變成這樣)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bù míngbái wèihé shìqíng huì biànchéng zhèyàng.
examples.english: She doesn’t understand why things turned out like this.

examples.chinese: 请说明此事与我有何关系(請說明此事與我有何關係)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng shuōmíng cǐ shì yǔ wǒ yǒu hé guānxì.
examples.english: Please explain what this has to do with me.
